title: (x) Classic cadillac logo - custom (similar to English 157) {Mark S, Patricia}
content:
Hey Folks,   
   
I'm trying to find the Cadillac script font (and am having very little luck). Does anyone know the font name and/or where to obtain it... hopefully for free? Here is an example of the font:   
   
 [http://www.alghanim.com/Automotive/images/cadillac%20logo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20110809062318/http:/www.alghanim.com/Automotive/images/cadillac%20logo.jpg)   
   
Thanks so much and have a beautiful day.   
   
Kevo
author: thereink

comments.content:
This is extremely unlikely to be based on a font. Automobile companies have lettering artists on staff just to do stuff like this (the most famous being Richard Isbell). They don't just go out and buy a font when they design a logo for a $30,000 car. They want something special, something exclusive.   
   
That said, it is possible that a Cadillac fan somewhere has created a free font modeled on this logo. Possible, but not likely, since scripts like this are one of the most difficult kind of fonts to do well.

There is no shortage of script fonts that can give you a similar look though. You could tweak [English157](http://web.archive.org/web/20110809062318/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/english-157-bt/english157-bt/testdrive.html?s=Cadillac&p=72). Slant it a bit, cut off the loop on the C, reduce the ascenders. But I'm sure there are others too.

Thanks for the input, Mark & Patty. I'll definitely grab the English157 and work with it while continuing to poke around for other variations.   
   
Have a wonderful night and Happy June.   
   
Kevin
